text: "God Bless Latvia" is the national anthem of Latvia. The words of the song was written in 1873 by a Latvian composer named KÄrlis Baumanis. The tune, which he had also composed himself, is similar to that of British anthem "God Save the King". It became the national anthem of the Baltic country in 1920.Dzintra Stelpe (2009). LielÄ Latvijas EnciklopÄ“dija. Riga: Zvaigzne ABC. p. 263. ISBN 9789984408095.
